CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION multiply(num1 string num2 string) RETURNS string  
        IF NOT (num1 NOT EQUALS string zero AND num2 NOT EQUALS string zero) THEN  
            RETURN string zero  
        END IF  

        SET intermediateList TO new list  
        SET lengthLimit TO (LENGTH OF num1) PLUS (LENGTH OF num2)  
        FOR counter FROM zero UPTO lengthLimit MINUS one  
            APPEND zero TO intermediateList  
        END FOR   

        SET reversedNum1 TO empty string  
        SET indexA TO LENGTH OF num1 MINUS one  
        WHILE indexA GREATER OR EQUAL TO zero DO  
            SET reversedNum1 TO reversedNum1 PLUS CHARACTER AT indexA OF num1  
            DECREMENT indexA BY one  
        END WHILE  
        SET num1 TO reversedNum1  

        SET reversedNum2 TO empty string  
        SET indexB TO LENGTH OF num2 MINUS one  
        WHILE indexB GREATER OR EQUAL TO zero DO  
            SET reversedNum2 TO reversedNum2 PLUS CHARACTER AT indexB OF num2  
            DECREMENT indexB BY one  
        END WHILE  
        SET num2 TO reversedNum2  

        SET posI TO zero  
        WHILE posI LESS THAN LENGTH OF num1 DO  
            SET posJ TO zero  
            WHILE posJ LESS THAN LENGTH OF num2 DO  
                SET codeA TO (CHARACTER CODE OF CHARACTER AT posI OF num1) MINUS (CHARACTER CODE OF string zero)  
                SET codeB TO (CHARACTER CODE OF CHARACTER AT posJ OF num2) MINUS (CHARACTER CODE OF string zero)  
                SET productVal TO codeA TIMES codeB  

                SET positionOne TO posI PLUS posJ  
                SET positionTwo TO positionOne PLUS one  

                SET combinedSum TO productVal PLUS ELEMENT AT positionOne OF intermediateList  

                SET ELEMENT AT positionOne OF intermediateList TO combinedSum MODULO ten  
                SET ELEMENT AT positionTwo OF intermediateList TO ELEMENT AT positionTwo OF intermediateList PLUS (combinedSum DIVIDED BY ten)  
                INCREMENT posJ BY one  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT posI BY one  
        END WHILE  

        SET reversedResultStr TO empty string  
        SET revIndex TO LENGTH OF intermediateList MINUS one  
        WHILE revIndex GREATER OR EQUAL TO zero DO  
            SET reversedResultStr TO reversedResultStr PLUS STRING OF ELEMENT AT revIndex OF intermediateList  
            DECREMENT revIndex BY one  
        END WHILE  

        SET startIndex TO zero  
        WHILE startIndex LESS THAN LENGTH OF reversedResultStr AND CHARACTER AT startIndex OF reversedResultStr EQUALS string zero DO  
            INCREMENT startIndex BY one  
        END WHILE  

        IF startIndex EQUALS LENGTH OF reversedResultStr THEN  
            RETURN string zero  
        END IF  

        RETURN SUBSTRING OF reversedResultStr FROM startIndex TO LENGTH OF reversedResultStr MINUS one  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

            END FOR  
        END FOR

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION canJump(nums)
        ASSIGN 0 TO positionIndex
        ASSIGN 0 TO maximumReach

        WHILE positionIndex LESS THAN LENGTH(nums)
            IF NOT(positionIndex LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO maximumReach)
                OUTPUT false
                EXIT FUNCTION
            END IF

            ASSIGN (positionIndex PLUS nums[positionIndex]) TO candidateReach
            IF candidateReach GREATER THAN maximumReach
                ASSIGN candidateReach TO maximumReach
            END IF

            INCREMENT positionIndex BY 1
        END WHILE

        IF maximumReach GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO (LENGTH(nums) MINUS 1)
            OUTPUT true
            EXIT FUNCTION
        END IF

        OUTPUT false
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION uniquePaths(m n)  
        SET matrix AS a list containing m elements, each being a list of length n filled with 1  
        SET rowIndex TO 1  
        WHILE rowIndex < m DO  
            SET columnIndex TO 1  
            WHILE columnIndex < n DO  
                SET currentRow TO matrix[rowIndex]  
                SET currentRow[columnIndex] TO matrix[rowIndex - 1][columnIndex] + currentRow[columnIndex - 1]  
                SET columnIndex TO columnIndex + 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET rowIndex TO rowIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN matrix[m - 1][n - 1]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION combine(n, k)
        FUNCTION backtrack(begin, sequence)
            IF NOT (LENGTH(sequence) NOT EQUAL TO k)
                result COLLECT COPY(sequence)
                RETURN
            END IF
            SET index TO begin
            WHILE index < n + 1
                sequence ADD index
                backtrack(index + 1, sequence)
                sequence REMOVE LAST
                index INCREASE BY 1
            END WHILE
        END FUNCTION
        result ASSIGN LIST()
        backtrack(1, LIST())
        RETURN result
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

                APPEND a COPY OF path TO result  
                RETURN  
            END IF  
            FOR i FROM start TO n PLUS one  
                APPEND i TO path  
                CALL backtrack WITH ARGUMENTS i PLUS one path  
                REMOVE the LAST ELEMENT FROM path  
            END FOR  
        END FUNCTION  
        SET result TO an EMPTY LIST  
        CALL backtrack WITH ARGUMENTS one AN EMPTY LIST  
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION grayCode(n)  
        DECLARE result AS list OF integers  
        DECLARE temp AS list OF integers  
        DECLARE bitmask AS integer  
        DECLARE index AS integer  
        
        IF NOT (n NOT EQUALS 0) THEN  
            RETURN [0]  
        END IF  
        
        SET temp AS grayCode(n - 1)  
        SET bitmask AS 1 << (n - 1)  
        
        SET result AS temp  
        SET index TO LENGTH(temp) - 1  
        
        WHILE index GREATER OR EQUAL TO 0 DO  
            APPEND (temp[index] BITWISE_OR bitmask) TO result  
            DECREMENT index BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION minCut(s)  
        SET length_s AS the LENGTH OF s  
        
        IF NOT (length_s GREATER THAN one)  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        
        SET palindrome_flag TO a list of length_s elements each containing a list of length_s elements initialized to FALSE  
        
        SET idx TO zero  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN length_s  
            SET palindrome_flag[idx][idx] AS TRUE  
            INCREMENT idx BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET substr_len TO two  
        WHILE substr_len LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO length_s  
            SET start_pos TO zero  
            WHILE start_pos LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO length_s MINUS substr_len  
                SET end_pos TO start_pos PLUS substr_len MINUS one  
                
                IF substr_len EQUALS two THEN  
                    SET palindrome_flag[start_pos][end_pos] AS (s[start_pos] EQUALS s[end_pos])  
                ELSE  
                    SET chars_match AS (s[start_pos] EQUALS s[end_pos])  
                    SET inner_palindrome AS palindrome_flag[start_pos PLUS one][end_pos MINUS one]  
                    SET palindrome_flag[start_pos][end_pos] AS (chars_match AND inner_palindrome)  
                END IF  
                
                INCREMENT start_pos BY one  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT substr_len BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET min_cut_counts TO a list of length_s elements initialized as zero  
        
        SET i TO zero  
        WHILE i LESS THAN length_s  
            IF palindrome_flag[zero][i] THEN  
                SET min_cut_counts[i] AS zero  
            ELSE  
                SET min_cut_counts[i] AS positive infinity  
                SET j TO one  
                WHILE j LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO i  
                    IF palindrome_flag[j][i] AND ((min_cut_counts[j MINUS one] PLUS one) LESS THAN min_cut_counts[i]) THEN  
                        SET min_cut_counts[i] AS (min_cut_counts[j MINUS one] PLUS one)  
                    END IF  
                    INCREMENT j BY one  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT i BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN min_cut_counts[length_s MINUS one]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION fractionToDecimal(numerator, denominator)  
        DECLARE polarity AS string  
        IF (numerator < 0 AND denominator >= 0) OR (numerator >= 0 AND denominator < 0) THEN  
            polarity ← "-"  
        ELSE  
            polarity ← ""  
        ENDIF  
  
        numerator ← ABS(numerator)  
        denominator ← ABS(denominator)  
  
        DECLARE integralQuotient AS integer ← numerator DIV denominator  
        DECLARE modValue AS integer ← numerator MOD denominator  
        DECLARE integerString AS string ← TO_STRING(integralQuotient)  
  
        IF modValue = 0 THEN  
            RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString)  
        ENDIF  
  
        DECLARE remainderPositions AS MAP FROM integer TO integer ← EMPTY MAP  
        DECLARE digits AS LIST OF string ← EMPTY LIST  
  
        DECLARE currentRemainder AS integer ← modValue  
        WHILE currentRemainder ≠ 0 DO  
            IF remainderPositions CONTAINS currentRemainder THEN  
                DECLARE cycleStart AS integer ← remainderPositions[currentRemainder]  
                DECLARE prefix AS string ← ""  
                DECLARE suffix AS string ← ""  
                FOR idx FROM 0 TO cycleStart - 1 DO  
                    prefix ← CONCAT(prefix, digits[idx])  
                ENDFOR  
                FOR idx FROM cycleStart TO LENGTH(digits) - 1 DO  
                    suffix ← CONCAT(suffix, digits[idx])  
                ENDFOR  
                RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString, ".", prefix, "(", suffix, ")")  
            ENDIF  
  
            remainderPositions[currentRemainder] ← LENGTH(digits)  
  
            currentRemainder ← currentRemainder * 10  
            DECLARE digitValue AS integer ← currentRemainder DIV denominator  
            currentRemainder ← currentRemainder MOD denominator  
            APPEND TO digits: TO_STRING(digitValue)  
        ENDWHILE  
  
        RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString, ".", JOIN(digits))  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION fractionToDecimal(numerator, denominator)  
        IF numerator LESS THAN zero AND denominator GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero OR numerator GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND denominator LESS THAN zero  
            SET sign TO the string indicating negative  
        ELSE  
            SET sign TO the empty string  
        END IF  
  
        SET numerator TO the absolute value of numerator  
        SET denominator TO the absolute value of denominator  
  
        SET quotient TO the integer division result of numerator DIVIDED BY denominator  
        SET remainder TO the remainder of numerator DIVIDED BY denominator  
        SET integer_part TO the string representation of quotient  
  
        IF remainder EQUALS zero  
            RETURN the concatenation of sign and integer_part  
        END IF  
  
        SET seen_remainders TO an empty mapping from remainder values to positions  
        SET fractional_part TO an empty list  
  
        WHILE remainder NOT EQUALS zero  
            IF remainder EXISTS AS a key in seen_remainders  
                SET start TO the value associated with remainder in seen_remainders  
                SET non_repeating TO the concatenation of elements from position zero UP TO position start EXCLUDING start in fractional_part  
                SET repeating TO the concatenation of elements FROM position start TO the end of fractional_part  
                RETURN the concatenation of sign, integer_part, the string representing a decimal point, non_repeating, the opening parenthesis string, repeating, and the closing parenthesis string  
            END IF  
  
            ASSIGN to seen_remainders at key remainder the current length of fractional_part  
  
            SET remainder TO remainder MULTIPLIED BY ten  
            SET quotient TO the integer division result of remainder DIVIDED BY denominator  
            SET remainder TO the remainder of remainder DIVIDED BY denominator  
            APPEND the string representation of quotient TO fractional_part  
        END WHILE  
  
        RETURN the concatenation of sign, integer_part, the string representing a decimal point, and the concatenation of all elements in fractional_part  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countPrimes WITH PARAMETER n  
        SWITCH  
            CASE n > 2:  
                BREAK  
            DEFAULT:  
                RETURN 0  
        END SWITCH  
        SET primality_flags AS empty list  
        SET counter AS 0  
        WHILE counter IS LESS THAN n DO  
            ADD True TO primality_flags  
            SET counter TO counter + 1  
        END WHILE  
        SET primality_flags[0] TO False  
        SET primality_flags[1] TO False  
        SET max_check AS FLOOR(SQRT(n))  
        SET candidate AS 2  
        WHILE candidate <= max_check DO  
            IF primality_flags[candidate] IS NOT False THEN  
                SET factor AS candidate * candidate  
                WHILE factor < n DO  
                    SET primality_flags[factor] TO False  
                    SET factor TO factor + candidate  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
            SET candidate TO candidate + 1  
        END WHILE  
        SET tally AS 0  
        FOR element IN primality_flags DO  
            IF element THEN tally ← tally + 1  
        END FOR  
        RETURN tally  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countPrimes WITH PARAMETER n  
        IF n LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO two  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        SET is_prime TO an empty list  
        FOR index FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            APPEND True TO is_prime  
        END FOR  
        SET element at position zero of is_prime TO False  
        SET element at position one of is_prime TO False  
        SET limit TO the integer part of the square root of n  
        FOR start FROM two TO limit PLUS one  
            IF element at position start of is_prime EQUALS True  
                SET multiple TO start MULTIPLIED BY start  
                WHILE multiple LESS THAN n  
                    SET element at position multiple of is_prime TO False  
                    INCREMENT multiple BY start  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        SET count TO zero  
        FOR each value IN is_prime  
            IF value EQUALS True  
                INCREMENT count BY one  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN count  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numSquares(n)  
        INITIALIZE dp AS a list WITH (n + 1) elements EACH SET TO infinity_value  
        ASSIGN dp[0] ← 0  
        INITIALIZE squares AS an empty list  
        ASSIGN counter ← 1  
        LOOP  
            IF (counter * counter) > n THEN EXIT LOOP  
            ADD (counter * counter) TO squares  
            SET counter ← counter + 1  
        END LOOP  
        ASSIGN index ← 1  
        WHILE index ≤ n DO  
            FOR EACH current_square IN squares DO  
                IF current_square > index THEN  
                    EXIT FOR  
                ELSE  
                    TEMP ← dp[index - current_square] + 1  
                    IF TEMP < dp[index] THEN  
                        SET dp[index] ← TEMP  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            SET index ← index + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN dp[n]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

            INCREMENT i BY one

        END FOR

    FUNCTION maxProduct(words)
        DECLARE char_sets AS empty list
        DECLARE idx1 AS 0
        WHILE idx1 < LENGTH(words)
            DECLARE temp_set AS empty set
            DECLARE pos AS 0
            WHILE pos < LENGTH(words[idx1])
                SET temp_set TO temp_set UNION { words[idx1][pos] }
                SET pos TO pos + 1
            END WHILE
            APPEND temp_set TO char_sets
            SET idx1 TO idx1 + 1
        END WHILE

        SET highest_product TO 0

        DECLARE first_pointer AS 0
        WHILE first_pointer < LENGTH(words) - 1
            DECLARE second_pointer AS first_pointer + 1
            WHILE second_pointer < LENGTH(words)
                DECLARE intersection_check AS char_sets[first_pointer] INTERSECT char_sets[second_pointer]
                IF LENGTH(intersection_check) = 0 THEN
                    DECLARE candidate_product AS (LENGTH(words[first_pointer]) * LENGTH(words[second_pointer]))
                    IF candidate_product > highest_product THEN
                        SET highest_product TO candidate_product
                    END IF
                END IF
                SET second_pointer TO second_pointer + 1
            END WHILE
            SET first_pointer TO first_pointer + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN highest_product
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION coinChange(coins, amount)  
        SET cache AS a list containing (amount + 1) copies of (amount + 1)  
        ASSIGN 0 TO cache[0]  

        SET counter TO 1  
        WHILE counter ≤ amount  
            SET currentMin TO cache[counter]  
            FOR each denomination IN coins  
                SET remainder TO counter - denomination  
                IF remainder ≥ 0 THEN  
                    SET candidate TO cache[remainder] + 1  
                    IF candidate < currentMin THEN  
                        ASSIGN candidate TO currentMin  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            ASSIGN currentMin TO cache[counter]  
            INCREMENT counter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        IF cache[amount] ≠ (amount + 1) THEN  
            RETURN cache[amount]  
        ELSE  
            RETURN -1  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION strongPasswordChecker(password)
        SET length_password AS LENGTH OF password
        SET lower_found AS EXISTS character IN password WHERE character IS lowercase letter
        SET upper_found AS EXISTS character IN password WHERE character IS uppercase letter
        SET digit_found AS EXISTS character IN password WHERE character IS digit

        SET missing_char_types AS 3 MINUS (lower_found PLUS upper_found PLUS digit_found)

        SET replacements_needed TO 0
        SET count_mod0 TO 0
        SET count_mod1 TO 0
        SET index_counter TO 2

        WHILE index_counter < length_password
            IF (password[index_counter] EQUALS password[index_counter - 1]) AND (password[index_counter] EQUALS password[index_counter - 2])
                SET streak_length TO 2
                WHILE (index_counter < length_password) AND (password[index_counter] EQUALS password[index_counter - 1])
                    SET streak_length TO (streak_length PLUS 1)
                    SET index_counter TO (index_counter PLUS 1)
                END WHILE

                SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed PLUS (streak_length DIV 3)

                IF (streak_length MOD 3) EQUALS 0
                    SET count_mod0 TO count_mod0 PLUS 1
                ELSE IF (streak_length MOD 3) EQUALS 1
                    SET count_mod1 TO count_mod1 PLUS 1
                END IF
            ELSE
                SET index_counter TO (index_counter PLUS 1)
            END IF
        END WHILE

        IF length_password < 6
            RETURN MAXIMUM OF missing_char_types AND (6 MINUS length_password)
        ELSE IF length_password <= 20
            RETURN MAXIMUM OF missing_char_types AND replacements_needed
        ELSE
            SET excess_length TO length_password MINUS 20

            SET min_del0 AS MINIMUM OF excess_length AND count_mod0
            SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed MINUS min_del0

            SET remaining_after_del0 TO MAXIMUM OF (excess_length MINUS min_del0) AND 0
            SET min_del1 AS MINIMUM OF remaining_after_del0 AND (count_mod1 TIMES 2)
            SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed MINUS (min_del1 DIV 2)

            SET remaining_after_del1 TO MAXIMUM OF (remaining_after_del0 MINUS min_del1) AND 0
            SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed MINUS (remaining_after_del1 DIV 3)

            RETURN excess_length PLUS MAXIMUM OF missing_char_types AND replacements_needed
        END IF
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

        SET replace TO zero

        SET i TO two  
        WHILE i LESS THAN n

                END IF  
            ELSE  
                INCREMENT i BY one  
            END IF  
        END WHILE  
        
        IF n LESS THAN six

    FUNCTION findContestMatch(n)  
        DECLARE bracketStrings AS empty list  
        DECLARE count AS 1  
        WHILE count LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO n  
            INSERT TO bracketStrings THE STRING OF count  
            INCREMENT count BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        WHILE n NOT EQUAL TO 1  
            DECLARE index AS 0  
            DECLARE limit AS n DIV 2  
            WHILE index LESS THAN limit  
                DECLARE leftSide AS bracketStrings AT index  
                DECLARE rightSide AS bracketStrings AT (n - 1 - index)  
                ASSIGN bracketStrings AT index TO "(" + leftSide + "," + rightSide + ")"  
                INCREMENT index BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET n AS n DIV 2  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN bracketStrings AT 0  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION nearestPalindromic(n)  
        SET lenCount AS LENGTH OF n  
        IF lenCount EQUALS 1  
            SET valNum AS integer VALUE OF n  
            RETURN string FORM valNum MINUS 1  
        END IF  
        
        SET candSet AS AN EMPTY SET  
        
        SET powLen AS 10 TO THE POWER OF lenCount  
        SET powLenMinusOne AS 10 TO THE POWER OF (lenCount MINUS 1)  
        
        ADD (powLen PLUS 1) TO candSet  
        ADD (powLenMinusOne MINUS 1) TO candSet  
        
        SET prefVal AS integer VALUE OF SUBSTRING OF n FROM 1 TO ((lenCount PLUS 1) DIVIDED BY 2)  
        
        SET idx AS -1  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO 1  
            SET newPrefNum AS prefVal PLUS idx  
            SET newPrefStr AS string FORM newPrefNum  
            
            IF (lenCount MOD 2) EQUALS 0 THEN
                SET revPart AS REVERSE OF newPrefStr  
                SET candStr AS newPrefStr CONCATENATED WITH revPart  
            ELSE  
                SET subRev AS REVERSE OF SUBSTRING OF newPrefStr FROM 1 TO (LENGTH OF newPrefStr MINUS 1)  
                SET candStr AS newPrefStr CONCATENATED WITH subRev  
            END IF  
            
            SET candNum AS integer VALUE OF candStr  
            ADD candNum TO candSet  
            
            SET idx AS idx PLUS 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET origNum AS integer VALUE OF n  
        IF candSet CONTAINS origNum THEN
            REMOVE origNum FROM candSet  
        END IF  
        
        SET bestCandidate AS NULL  
        SET minDist AS POSITIVE_INFINITY  
        
        FOR EACH num IN candSet  
            SET dist AS ABSOLUTE VALUE OF (num MINUS origNum)  
            IF (dist LESS THAN minDist) OR (dist EQUALS minDist AND num LESS THAN bestCandidate) THEN
                SET bestCandidate AS num  
                SET minDist AS dist  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN string FORM bestCandidate  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

            END IF  

            IF baseline_max < segment_maximum THEN  
                SET baseline_max TO segment_maximum  
            END IF  

            SET cursor TO cursor + 1  
        END WHILE

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION judgeSquareSum WITH parameter c  
        SET upperBound AS INTEGER PART OF THE SQUARE ROOT OF c  
        SET lowerBound AS 0  
        LOOP FOREVER  
            IF lowerBound GREATER THAN upperBound THEN  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  
            SET total AS (upperBound * upperBound) + (lowerBound * lowerBound)  
            SWITCH total COMPARED TO c  
                CASE EQUAL:  
                    RETURN true  
                CASE LESS:  
                    SET lowerBound TO lowerBound + 1  
                CASE GREATER:  
                    SET upperBound TO upperBound - 1  
            END SWITCH  
        END LOOP  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

            IF current_sum EQUALS c THEN  
                RETURN true  
            ELSE IF current_sum LESS THAN c THEN  
                INCREMENT left BY one  
            ELSE  
                DECREMENT right BY one  
            END IF  
        END WHILE

            SET total_number TO 0

            SET position TO 0
            WHILE position < LENGTH(tokens_list)
                SET element TO tokens_list[position]
                IF element = '' THEN
                    SET position TO position + 1
                    CONTINUE
                END IF

                SET contains_x TO FALSE
                SET char_index TO 0
                WHILE char_index < LENGTH(element)
                    IF element[char_index] = 'x' THEN
                        SET contains_x TO TRUE
                        BREAK
                    END IF
                    SET char_index TO char_index + 1
                END WHILE

                IF contains_x THEN
                    SWITCH element
                        CASE 'x':
                            SET coefficient_x TO coefficient_x + 1
                        CASE '+x':
                            SET coefficient_x TO coefficient_x + 1
                        CASE '-x':
                            SET coefficient_x TO coefficient_x - 1
                        DEFAULT:
                            SET extracted_number TO SUBSTRING(element, 0, LENGTH(element) - 1)
                            SET coefficient_x TO coefficient_x + TO_INTEGER(extracted_number)
                    END SWITCH
                ELSE
                    SET total_number TO total_number + TO_INTEGER(element)
                END IF

                SET position TO position + 1
            END WHILE

            RETURN coefficient_x, total_number
        END FUNCTION

        SET parts TO SPLIT(equation, '=')
        SET left_part TO parts[0]
        SET right_part TO parts[1]

        SET left_coefficient, left_sum TO parse_side(left_part)
        SET right_coefficient, right_sum TO parse_side(right_part)

        SET net_coefficient TO left_coefficient - right_coefficient
        SET net_sum TO right_sum - left_sum

        IF NOT (net_coefficient <> 0) THEN
            IF NOT (net_sum <> 0) THEN
                RETURN "Infinite solutions"
            ELSE
                RETURN "No solution"
            END IF
        ELSE
            RETURN CONCAT("x=", TO_STRING(net_sum DIV net_coefficient))
        END IF
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION solveEquation(equation)  
        FUNCTION parse_side(side)  
            SET tokens TO the result of replacing plus signs in side with delimiter plus sign and replacing minus signs in side with delimiter minus sign and splitting the resulting string by the delimiter  
            SET x_count TO zero  
            SET num_sum TO zero  
            FOR each token IN tokens  
                IF token is an empty string THEN  
                    CONTINUE to the next token  
                END IF  
                IF the character x exists in token THEN  
                    IF token is equal to x OR token is equal to plus sign followed by x THEN  
                        INCREMENT x_count BY one  
                    ELSE IF token is equal to minus sign followed by x THEN  
                        DECREMENT x_count BY one  
                    ELSE  
                        INCREMENT x_count BY the integer value of token with character x removed  
                    END IF  
                ELSE  
                    INCREMENT num_sum BY the integer value of token  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            RETURN x_count and num_sum  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET left_side and right_side TO the parts of equation separated by the equal sign  
        SET left_x and left_num TO the result of calling parse_side with left_side  
        SET right_x and right_num TO the result of calling parse_side with right_side  

        SET total_x TO left_x MINUS right_x  
        SET total_num TO right_num MINUS left_num  

        IF total_x EQUALS zero THEN  
            IF total_num EQUALS zero THEN  
                RETURN the string Infinite solutions  
            ELSE  
                RETURN the string No solution  
            END IF  
        ELSE  
            RETURN the string formed by the character x equals the integer result of total_num DIVIDED BY total_x  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION predictPartyVictory(senate)

        DECLARE direQueue AS an empty double-ended queue

            IF NOT (partyChar NOT EQUAL TO 'R')

            REMOVE FIRST ELEMENT FROM direQueue AND ASSIGN TO direPos  

            IF radiantPos - direPos < 0 THEN  
                APPEND radiantPos + radiantLen TO radiantQueue  
            ELSE  
                APPEND direPos + radiantLen TO direQueue  
            END IF  
        END LOOP  

        IF radiantQueue IS EMPTY IS FALSE THEN  
            RETURN "Radiant"  
        END IF  
        RETURN "Dire"  
    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION repeatedStringMatch(a string, b string) RETURNS integer

    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minimumDeleteSum(s1, s2)  
        SET length_s1 AS LENGTH OF s1  
        SET length_s2 AS LENGTH OF s2  
        
        DECLARE dp AS LIST OF LISTS WITH (length_s1 + 1) ROWS AND (length_s2 + 1) COLUMNS FILLED WITH 0  
        
        SET idx_col TO 1  
        WHILE idx_col <= length_s2  
            LET previous_value BE dp[0][idx_col - 1]  
            LET ascii_code BE ASCII OF s2[idx_col - 1]  
            dp[0][idx_col] ← previous_value + ascii_code  
            idx_col ← idx_col + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET idx_row TO 1  
        WHILE idx_row <= length_s1  
            LET previous_value_row BE dp[idx_row - 1][0]  
            LET ascii_code_row BE ASCII OF s1[idx_row - 1]  
            dp[idx_row][0] ← previous_value_row + ascii_code_row  
            idx_row ← idx_row + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET outer_index TO 1  
        WHILE outer_index <= length_s1  
            SET inner_index TO 1  
            WHILE inner_index <= length_s2  
                LET char_s1 BE s1[outer_index - 1]  
                LET char_s2 BE s2[inner_index - 1]  
                IF char_s1 ≠ char_s2 THEN
                    LET deletion_s1 COST ← dp[outer_index - 1][inner_index] + ASCII OF char_s1  
                    LET deletion_s2 COST ← dp[outer_index][inner_index - 1] + ASCII OF char_s2  
                    LET dp[outer_index][inner_index] BE MINIMUM OF deletion_s1 COST AND deletion_s2 COST  
                ELSE  
                    LET dp[outer_index][inner_index] BE dp[outer_index - 1][inner_index - 1]  
                END IF  
                inner_index ← inner_index + 1  
            END WHILE  
            outer_index ← outer_index + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN dp[length_s1][length_s2]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countPalindromicSubsequences WITH PARAMETER s  
        DECLARE MOD AS 1000000007  
        DECLARE length_s AS LENGTH OF s  
        
        DECLARE next_occurrence AS LIST CONTAINING 4 ELEMENTS EACH INITIALIZED TO LIST OF length_s ELEMENTS SET TO -1  
        DECLARE prev_occurrence AS LIST CONTAINING 4 ELEMENTS EACH INITIALIZED TO LIST OF length_s ELEMENTS SET TO -1  
        
        SET index_c TO 0  
        WHILE index_c LESS THAN 4 DO  
            SET current_char TO CHARACTER AT (ASCII('a') + index_c)  
            SET last_seen TO -1  
            
            SET pos_idx TO 0  
            WHILE pos_idx LESS THAN length_s DO  
                IF s ELEMENT AT pos_idx EQUALS current_char THEN  
                    SET last_seen TO pos_idx  
                END IF  
                SET prev_occurrence[index_c][pos_idx] TO last_seen  
                INCREMENT pos_idx BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            
            SET last_seen TO -1  
            SET pos_idx TO length_s - 1  
            WHILE pos_idx GREATER OR EQUAL TO 0 DO  
                IF s ELEMENT AT pos_idx EQUALS current_char THEN  
                    SET last_seen TO pos_idx  
                END IF  
                SET next_occurrence[index_c][pos_idx] TO last_seen  
                DECREMENT pos_idx BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            
            INCREMENT index_c BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        DECLARE dp AS LIST OF length_s ELEMENTS EACH BEING A LIST OF length_s ELEMENTS SET TO 0  
        
        SET diag_idx TO 0  
        WHILE diag_idx LESS THAN length_s DO  
            SET dp[diag_idx][diag_idx] TO 1  
            INCREMENT diag_idx BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET current_len TO 2  
        WHILE current_len LESS OR EQUAL TO length_s DO  
            SET start_pos TO 0  
            WHILE start_pos + current_len - 1 LESS THAN length_s DO  
                SET end_pos TO start_pos + current_len - 1  
                SET color_code TO 0  
                WHILE color_code LESS THAN 4 DO  
                    SET current_char TO CHARACTER AT (ASCII('a') + color_code)  
                    SET left_idx TO next_occurrence[color_code][start_pos]  
                    SET right_idx TO prev_occurrence[color_code][end_pos]  
                    
                    IF left_idx GREATER THAN end_pos OR right_idx LESS THAN start_pos THEN  
                        # skip this iteration  
                    ELSE  
                        IF left_idx EQUALS right_idx THEN  
                            SET dp[start_pos][end_pos] TO (dp[start_pos][end_pos] + 1) MOD MOD  
                        ELSE  
                            DECLARE addition AS dp[left_idx + 1][right_idx - 1]  
                            dp[start_pos][end_pos] ← (dp[start_pos][end_pos] + addition + 2) MOD MOD  
                        END IF  
                    END IF  
                    
                    INCREMENT color_code BY 1  
                END WHILE  
                INCREMENT start_pos BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT current_len BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN dp[0][length_s - 1]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION canTransform(start parameter, end parameter)  
        INITIALIZE filteredStart AS empty list  
        INITIALIZE posCounter TO 0  
        WHILE posCounter < LENGTH(start parameter) DO  
            ASSIGN currentChar TO start parameter[posCounter]  
            IF NOT (currentChar = 'X') THEN  
                SET filteredStart TO filteredStart CONCATENATED WITH [(currentChar, posCounter)]  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT posCounter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        INITIALIZE filteredEnd AS empty list  
        ASSIGN idxCursor TO 0  
        WHILE idxCursor < LENGTH(end parameter) DO  
            ASSIGN ch TO end parameter[idxCursor]  
            IF ch <> 'X' THEN  
                SET filteredEnd TO filteredEnd + [(ch, idxCursor)]  
            END IF  
            ASSIGN idxCursor TO idxCursor + 1  
        END WHILE  

        IF LENGTH(filteredStart) != LENGTH(filteredEnd) THEN  
            RETURN false  
        END IF  

        INITIALIZE pairIndex TO 0  
        WHILE pairIndex < LENGTH(filteredStart) DO  
            ASSIGN firstTuple TO filteredStart[pairIndex]  
            ASSIGN secondTuple TO filteredEnd[pairIndex]  

            ASSIGN charA TO firstTuple[0]  
            ASSIGN posA TO firstTuple[1]  
            ASSIGN charB TO secondTuple[0]  
            ASSIGN posB TO secondTuple[1]  

            IF NOT (charA = charB) THEN  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  

            IF charA = 'L' THEN  
                IF posA < posB THEN  
                    RETURN false  
                END IF  
            ELSE IF charA = 'R' THEN  
                IF posA > posB THEN  
                    RETURN false  
                END IF  
            END IF  

            SET pairIndex TO pairIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN true  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION reachingPoints(sx sx PARAMETER sy sy PARAMETER tx tx PARAMETER ty ty) RETURNS boolean
        LOOP_WHILE (tx IS_NOT_LESS_THAN sx) AND (ty IS_NOT_LESS_THAN sy)
            IF (NOT (tx IS_DIFFERS_FROM sx)) AND (NOT (ty IS_DIFFERS_FROM sy))
                RETURN True
            END IF

            IF tx IS_GREATER_THAN ty
                IF ty IS_GREATER_THAN sy
                    LET dividend = tx
                    LET divisor = ty
                    LET remainder = dividend MINUS (divisor TIMES FLOOR(dividend DIVIDED_BY divisor))
                    ASSIGN remainder INTO tx
                ELSE
                    LET numerator = tx MINUS sx
                    LET denominator = ty
                    LET modulusResult = numerator MINUS (denominator TIMES FLOOR(numerator DIVIDED_BY denominator))
                    IF NOT (modulusResult IS_NOT_EQUAL_ZERO)
                        RETURN True
                    ELSE
                        RETURN False
                    END IF
                END IF
            ELSE
                IF tx IS_GREATER_THAN sx
                    LET dividend = ty
                    LET divisor = tx
                    LET remainder = dividend MINUS (divisor TIMES FLOOR(dividend DIVIDED_BY divisor))
                    ASSIGN remainder INTO ty
                ELSE
                    LET numerator = ty MINUS sy
                    LET denominator = tx
                    LET modulusResult = numerator MINUS (denominator TIMES FLOOR(numerator DIVIDED_BY denominator))
                    IF NOT (modulusResult IS_NOT_EQUAL_ZERO)
                        RETURN True
                    ELSE
                        RETURN False
                    END IF
                END IF
            END IF
        END LOOP_WHILE
        RETURN False
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

                END IF  
            END IF  
            counter = counter + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN True  
    END FUNCTION

            SET element at position two of dp1 TO one  
        END IF  
        
        FOR i FROM three TO n DO  
            SET element at position i of dp TO the remainder of the sum of element at position i MINUS one of dp PLUS element at position i MINUS two of dp PLUS two MULTIPLIED BY element at position i MINUS one of dp1 when divided by MOD  
            SET element at position i of dp1 TO the remainder of the sum of element at position i MINUS two of dp PLUS element at position i MINUS one of dp1 when divided by MOD  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN element at position n of dp  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numBusesToDestination(routes PARAMETER, source PARAMETER, target PARAMETER)  
        IF NOT (source NOT EQUAL target)  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  

        INITIALIZE busMap AS a new empty mapping DefaultDict of list  
        SET i TO 0  
        WHILE i LESS THAN LENGTH OF routes  
            SET currentRoute TO routes[i]  
            SET j TO 0  
            WHILE j LESS THAN LENGTH OF currentRoute  
                APPEND i TO busMap[currentRoute[j]]  
                SET j TO j PLUS 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET i TO i PLUS 1  
        END WHILE  

        INITIALIZE queue AS an empty double ended queue  
        INITIALIZE visitedBuses AS an empty set  
        INITIALIZE seenStops AS an empty set  

        FOR each busIndex IN busMap[source]  
            ENQUEUE (busIndex, 1) INTO queue  
            INSERT busIndex INTO visitedBuses  
        END FOR  
        INSERT source INTO seenStops  

        WHILE queue IS NOT EMPTY  
            DEQUEUE FROM queue INTO currentBus, currentCount  

            SET k TO 0  
            WHILE k LESS THAN LENGTH OF routes[currentBus]  
                SET currStop TO routes[currentBus][k]  

                IF currStop EQUALS target  
                    RETURN currentCount  
                END IF  

                IF currStop NOT IN seenStops  
                    INSERT currStop INTO seenStops  

                    FOR each nextBus IN busMap[currStop]  
                        IF nextBus NOT IN visitedBuses  
                            INSERT nextBus INTO visitedBuses  
                            ENQUEUE (nextBus, currentCount PLUS 1) INTO queue  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  

                SET k TO k PLUS 1  
            END WHILE  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN -1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        END IF

        FOR each bus WITH index bus_index AND route IN routes  
            FOR each stop IN route  
                APPEND bus_index TO the list corresponding to stop IN stop_to_buses  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        SET bus_queue TO an empty double ended queue  
        SET visited_buses TO an empty set  
        SET visited_stops TO an empty set  

        FOR each bus IN the list of buses at the source stop FROM stop_to_buses

            ADD bus TO visited_buses  
            ADD source TO visited_stops  
        END FOR  

        WHILE bus_queue is not empty  
            REMOVE the first element FROM bus_queue AND ASSIGN the elements TO current_bus AND bus_count  

            FOR each stop IN the route at position current_bus OF routes  
                IF stop EQUALS target  
                    RETURN bus_count  
                END IF  

                IF stop NOT IN visited_stops  
                    ADD stop TO visited_stops  
                    FOR each next_bus IN the list of buses at stop FROM stop_to_buses

                            ADD next_bus TO visited_buses  
                            APPEND the tuple consisting of next_bus AND bus_count PLUS one TO bus_queue  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN negative one  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numFactoredBinaryTrees(arr)  
        ASSIGN MODULO_CONST ← (10 ^ 9) + 7  
        SORT arr BY ascending order  
        
        INITIALIZE factorsCount AS empty mapping  
        FOR each element IN arr DO  
            SET factorsCount[element] ← 1  
        END FOR  
        
        SET outerIdx ← 0  
        WHILE outerIdx < LENGTH(arr) DO  
            SET currentVal ← arr[outerIdx]  
            SET innerIdx ← 0  
            WHILE innerIdx < outerIdx DO  
                SET divisorCandidate ← arr[innerIdx]  
                IF (currentVal − (currentVal DIV divisorCandidate) * divisorCandidate) = 0 THEN  
                    SET pairedFactor ← currentVal DIV divisorCandidate  
                    IF pairedFactor IN factorsCount THEN  
                        SET product ← factorsCount[divisorCandidate] * factorsCount[pairedFactor]  
                        SET factorsCount[currentVal] ← (factorsCount[currentVal] + product) MODULO MODULO_CONST  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                INCREMENT innerIdx BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT outerIdx BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        ASSIGN accumulation ← 0  
        FOR each countValue IN factorsCount DO  
            SET accumulation ← accumulation + countValue  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN accumulation MODULO MODULO_CONST  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        SET total TO zero  
        FOR each value IN dp values  
            INCREMENT total BY value  
        END FOR  
        RETURN total MODULO MOD  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numMagicSquaresInside(grid)  
        FUNCTION is_magic(i, j)  
            IF grid[i][j] ≠ 5 THEN  
                RETURN False  
            END IF  

            SET unique_values AS empty set  
            SET a AS i - 1  
            WHILE a ≤ i + 1 DO  
                SET b AS j - 1  
                WHILE b ≤ j + 1 DO  
                    SET val AS grid[a][b]  
                    IF val < 1 OR val > 9 OR val IN unique_values THEN  
                        RETURN False  
                    END IF  
                    INSERT val INTO unique_values  
                    b ← b + 1  
                END WHILE  
                a ← a + 1  
            END WHILE  

            SET c AS i - 1  
            REPEAT UNTIL c > i + 1  
                SET row_sum AS grid[c][j - 1] + grid[c][j] + grid[c][j + 1]  
                SET col_sum AS grid[i - 1][c] + grid[i][c] + grid[i + 1][c]  

                IF row_sum ≠ 15 THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                ELSE IF col_sum ≠ 15 THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  

                c ← c + 1  
            END REPEAT  

            SWITCH TRUE  
                CASE grid[i - 1][j - 1] + grid[i][j] + grid[i + 1][j + 1] ≠ 15:  
                    RETURN False  
                CASE grid[i - 1][j + 1] + grid[i][j] + grid[i + 1][j - 1] ≠ 15:  
                    RETURN False  
            END SWITCH  

            RETURN True  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET total_count AS 0  
        SET row_count AS LENGTH(grid)  
        SET column_count AS LENGTH(grid[0])  
        SET idx_i AS 1  
        WHILE idx_i < row_count - 1 DO  
            SET idx_j AS 1  
            WHILE idx_j < column_count - 1 DO  
                IF is_magic(idx_i, idx_j) THEN  
                    total_count ← total_count + 1  
                END IF  
                idx_j ← idx_j + 1  
            END WHILE  
            idx_i ← idx_i + 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN total_count  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION longestMountain(arr)
        SET length_arr AS LENGTH OF arr
        SET maximum_length TO 0
        SET index_counter TO 1
        LOOP
            IF NOT (index_counter < length_arr - 1) THEN
                BREAK
            END IF

            IF (arr[index_counter - 1] < arr[index_counter]) AND (arr[index_counter] > arr[index_counter + 1]) THEN
                SET left_marker AS index_counter - 1
                SET right_marker AS index_counter + 1

                WHILE (left_marker > 0) AND (arr[left_marker - 1] < arr[left_marker])
                    left_marker ← left_marker - 1
                END WHILE

                WHILE (right_marker < length_arr - 1) AND (arr[right_marker] > arr[right_marker + 1])
                    right_marker ← right_marker + 1
                END WHILE

                SET current_mountain_length AS right_marker - left_marker + 1
                IF maximum_length < current_mountain_length THEN
                    maximum_length ← current_mountain_length
                END IF

                index_counter ← right_marker
            ELSE
                index_counter ← index_counter + 1
            END IF
        END LOOP
        RETURN maximum_length
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION longestMountain(arr)

        WHILE i LESS THAN n MINUS one  
            IF element at position i MINUS one of arr LESS THAN element at position i of arr AND element at position i of arr GREATER THAN element at position i PLUS one of arr  
                SET left TO i MINUS one  
                SET right TO i PLUS one  
                WHILE left GREATER THAN zero AND element at position left MINUS one of arr LESS THAN element at position left of arr  
                    DECREMENT left BY one  
                END WHILE  
                WHILE right LESS THAN n MINUS one AND element at position right of arr GREATER THAN element at position right PLUS one of arr  
                    INCREMENT right BY one  
                END WHILE  
                IF longest LESS THAN right MINUS left PLUS one  
                    SET longest TO right MINUS left PLUS one  
                END IF  
                SET i TO right  
            ELSE  
                INCREMENT i BY one  
            END IF  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN longest  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION carFleet(target, position, speed)  
        SET combinedPairs AS EMPTY LIST  
        SET idx TO 0  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN LENGTH OF position  
            APPEND (position[idx], speed[idx]) TO combinedPairs  
            INCREMENT idx BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        SORT combinedPairs BY FIRST ELEMENT DESCENDING  

        SET arrivalTimes AS EMPTY LIST  
        SET pairIndex TO 0  
        WHILE pairIndex LESS THAN LENGTH OF combinedPairs  
            LET loc BE combinedPairs[pairIndex][0]  
            LET vel BE combinedPairs[pairIndex][1]  
            LET timeVal BE (target MINUS loc) DIVIDED BY vel  
            APPEND timeVal TO arrivalTimes  
            INCREMENT pairIndex BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        SET fleetCount TO 0  
        SET maxObservedTime TO 0  

        SET timeIdx TO 0  
        WHILE timeIdx LESS THAN LENGTH OF arrivalTimes  
            LET currentTime BE arrivalTimes[timeIdx]  
            IF NOT (currentTime LESS OR EQUAL maxObservedTime) THEN  
                SET maxObservedTime TO currentTime  
                SET fleetCount TO fleetCount PLUS 1  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT timeIdx BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN fleetCount  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        SET time_to_target TO an empty list  
        FOR each pair IN paired_list

            SET s TO the second component of pair  
            SET time TO target MINUS p DIVIDED BY s  
            APPEND time TO time_to_target  
        END FOR  

        SET fleets TO zero  
        SET current_max_time TO zero  

        FOR each time IN time_to_target  
            IF time GREATER THAN current_max_time  
                INCREMENT fleets BY one  
                SET current_max_time TO time  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        RETURN fleets  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION shortestPathAllKeys(grid)  
        SET vectors AS the collection of pairs [(1,0), (-1,0), (0,1), (0,-1)]  
        SET height AS LENGTH OF grid  
        SET width AS LENGTH OF grid AT INDEX zero  
        SET origin WITH NO INITIAL VALUE  
        SET total_keys AS 0  
        SET row_idx AS 0  
        WHILE row_idx < height  
            SET col_idx AS 0  
            WHILE col_idx < width  
                IF grid AT row_idx AND col_idx IS '@' THEN  
                    SET origin TO (row_idx, col_idx)  
                ELSE IF 'a' <= grid AT row_idx AND col_idx AND grid AT row_idx AND col_idx <= 'z' THEN  
                    SET total_keys TO total_keys + 1  
                END IF  
                SET col_idx TO col_idx + 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET row_idx TO row_idx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        SET frontier AS A new deque INITIALIZED WITH [(origin AT INDEX zero, origin AT INDEX one, 0, 0)]  
        SET encountered AS A set WITH {(origin AT INDEX zero, origin AT INDEX one, 0)}  
        
        WHILE NOT EMPTY frontier  
            SET curr_x, curr_y, acquired_keys, step_count TO POP LEFT frontier  
            FOR EACH vector_x, vector_y IN vectors  
                SET next_x TO curr_x + vector_x  
                SET next_y TO curr_y + vector_y  
                
                IF 0 <= next_x AND next_x < height AND 0 <= next_y AND next_y < width THEN  
                    SET cell_value TO grid AT next_x AND next_y  
                    IF cell_value = '#' THEN  
                        CONTINUE TO NEXT ITERATION  
                    END IF  
                    IF 'A' <= cell_value AND cell_value <= 'Z' THEN  
                        SET lock_bit TO 1 << (ORD(LOWERCASE cell_value) - ORD('a'))  
                        IF (acquired_keys & lock_bit) = 0 THEN  
                            CONTINUE TO NEXT ITERATION  
                        END IF  
                    END IF  
                    IF 'a' <= cell_value AND cell_value <= 'z' THEN  
                        SET updated_keys TO (acquired_keys | 1 << (ORD cell_value - ORD 'a'))  
                        IF updated_keys = (1 << total_keys) - 1 THEN  
                            RETURN step_count + 1  
                        END IF  
                    ELSE  
                        SET updated_keys TO acquired_keys  
                    END IF  
                    
                    IF (next_x, next_y, updated_keys) NOT IN encountered THEN  
                        ADD (next_x, next_y, updated_keys) TO encountered  
                        APPEND (next_x, next_y, updated_keys, step_count + 1) TO frontier  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN -1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION parseBoolExpr(expression)  
        INITIALIZE container AS empty list  
        SET pointer TO 0  
        WHILE pointer LESS THAN length of expression  
            LET symbol BE element at position pointer in expression  
            
            SWITCH symbol  
                CASE 't', 'f', '!', '&', '|'  
                    ADD symbol TO container  
                    INCREMENT pointer BY 1  
                    CONTINUE  
                CASE ')'  
                    DECLARE tally_true AS 0  
                    DECLARE tally_false AS 0  
                    
                    WHILE container[last element] IS 't' OR container[last element] IS 'f'  
                        LET current_char BE container[last element]  
                        
                        IF current_char IS 't'  
                            SET tally_true TO tally_true + 1  
                        END IF  
                        IF current_char IS 'f'  
                            SET tally_false TO tally_false + 1  
                        END IF  
                        REMOVE last element FROM container  
                    END WHILE  
                    
                    LET operator_char BE container[last element]  
                    REMOVE last element FROM container  
                    
                    IF operator_char IS '!'  
                        IF tally_false NOT EQUAL TO 0  
                            SET symbol TO 't'  
                        ELSE  
                            SET symbol TO 'f'  
                        END IF  
                    ELSE IF operator_char IS '&'  
                        IF tally_false NOT EQUAL TO 0  
                            SET symbol TO 'f'  
                        ELSE  
                            SET symbol TO 't'  
                        END IF  
                    ELSE IF operator_char IS '|'  
                        IF tally_true NOT EQUAL TO 0  
                            SET symbol TO 't'  
                        ELSE

            IF NOT (candidateSubstring >= tempSubstring) THEN  
                SET candidateSubstring TO tempSubstring  
            END IF  
            SET posIndex TO posIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN candidateSubstring  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION dieSimulator(n, rollMax)
        SET MOD TO 1000000007

        SET dp TO list of size (n + 1), EACH element a list of size 6, EACH element a list of zeros of size (max element in rollMax + 1)

        SET idx TO 0
        WHILE idx LESS_THAN 6
            SET temp_list TO dp[1][idx]
            temp_list[1] ← 1
            idx ← idx + 1
        END WHILE

        SET i TO 2
        WHILE i LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL n
            SET j TO 0
            WHILE j LESS_THAN 6
                SET k TO 1
                WHILE k LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL rollMax[j]
                    IF k LESS_THAN 2
                        SET acc TO 0
                        SET x TO 0
                        WHILE x LESS_THAN 6
                            IF x NOT_EQUALS j THEN
                                SET y TO 1
                                WHILE y LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL rollMax[x]
                                    acc ← acc + dp[i - 1][x][y]
                                    y ← y + 1
                                END WHILE
                            END IF
                            x ← x + 1
                        END WHILE
                        dp[i][j][k] ← acc MOD MOD
                    ELSE
                        dp[i][j][k] ← dp[i - 1][j][k - 1]
                    END IF
                    k ← k + 1
                END WHILE
                j ← j + 1
            END WHILE
            i ← i + 1
        END WHILE

        SET final_result TO 0  
        FOR INDEX j FROM 0 TO 5
            SET subIdx TO 1
            WHILE subIdx LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL rollMax[j]
                ADD dp[n][j][subIdx] TO final_result
                subIdx ← subIdx + 1
            END WHILE  
        END FOR

        RETURN final_result MOD MOD
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION largestMultipleOfThree(digits)  
        SET freq_map AS a mapping from digits to their counts in digits  
        SET summation TO 0  
        FOR index FROM 0 TO LENGTH OF digits MINUS 1  
            summation ← summation PLUS digits[index]  
        END FOR  
        SET mod_val AS summation MODULO 3  
        
        SWITCH mod_val  
            CASE 1:  
                DEFINE singles AS [1, 4, 7]  
                SET changed_flag AS false  
                SET pointer AS 0  
                WHILE pointer < LENGTH OF singles AND changed_flag EQUALS false  
                    IF freq_map CONTAINS singles[pointer] AND freq_map[singles[pointer]] > 0 THEN  
                        freq_map[singles[pointer]] ← freq_map[singles[pointer]] MINUS 1  
                        changed_flag ← true  
                    END IF  
                    pointer ← pointer PLUS 1  
                END WHILE  
                IF changed_flag EQUALS false THEN  
                    DEFINE doubles AS [2, 5, 8]  
                    SET idx AS 0  
                    WHILE idx < LENGTH OF doubles AND changed_flag EQUALS false  
                        IF freq_map CONTAINS doubles[idx] AND freq_map[doubles[idx]] > 1 THEN  
                            freq_map[doubles[idx]] ← freq_map[doubles[idx]] MINUS 2  
                            changed_flag ← true  
                        END IF  
                        idx ← idx PLUS 1  
                    END WHILE  
                END IF  
                BREAK  
            
            CASE 2:  
                DEFINE singles_arr AS [2, 5, 8]  
                SET done AS false  
                SET position AS 0  
                WHILE position < LENGTH OF singles_arr AND done EQUALS false  
                    IF freq_map CONTAINS singles_arr[position] AND freq_map[singles_arr[position]] > 0 THEN  
                        freq_map[singles_arr[position]] ← freq_map[singles_arr[position]] MINUS 1  
                        done ← true  
                    END IF  
                    position ← position PLUS 1  
                END WHILE  
                IF done EQUALS false THEN  
                    DEFINE doubles_arr AS [1, 4, 7]  
                    SET pos AS 0  
                    WHILE pos < LENGTH OF doubles_arr AND done EQUALS false  
                        IF freq_map CONTAINS doubles_arr[pos] AND freq_map[doubles_arr[pos]] > 1 THEN  
                            freq_map[doubles_arr[pos]] ← freq_map[doubles_arr[pos]] MINUS 2  
                            done ← true  
                        END IF  
                        pos ← pos PLUS 1  
                    END WHILE  
                END IF  
                BREAK  
            DEFAULT:  
                // no action needed  
                BREAK  
        END SWITCH  
        
        SET output_segments AS an empty list  
        SET digit_val AS 9  
        WHILE digit_val >= 0  
            IF freq_map CONTAINS digit_val THEN  
                SET count_value AS freq_map[digit_val]  
                SET part_str AS empty string  
                SET iter_num AS 0  
                WHILE iter_num < count_value  
                    part_str ← part_str CONCATENATED WITH STRING OF digit_val  
                    iter_num ← iter_num PLUS 1  
                END WHILE  
                IF LENGTH OF part_str > 0 THEN  
                    output_segments APPEND part_str  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            digit_val ← digit_val MINUS 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET assembled_str AS empty string  
        FOR each segment IN output_segments  
            assembled_str ← assembled_str CONCATENATED WITH segment  
        END FOR  
        
        IF LENGTH OF assembled_str > 0 THEN  
            IF assembled_str[0] EQUALS "0" THEN  
                RETURN "0"  
            END IF  
        ELSE  
            RETURN ""  
        END IF  
        
        RETURN assembled_str  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION numberOfArrays(s PARAMETER string, k PARAMETER integer) RETURNS integer
        SET MOD TO 1000000000 PLUS 7
        SET length_s TO LENGTH OF s
        INITIALIZE dp AS an array containing (length_s PLUS 1) zeros
        SET dp[0] AS 1

        SET outer_index TO 1
        WHILE outer_index LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO length_s DO
            SET inner_idx TO 0
            WHILE inner_idx LESS THAN outer_index DO
                SET current_char TO s[inner_idx]
                IF NOT (current_char EQUALS '0') THEN

                    IF (num_value GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO 1) AND (num_value LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO k) THEN
                        SET dp[outer_index] TO (dp[outer_index] PLUS dp[inner_idx]) MODULO MOD
                    END IF
                END IF
                INCREMENT inner_idx BY 1
            END WHILE
            INCREMENT outer_index BY 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN dp[length_s]
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION kthSmallest(mat AS List OF List OF Integer k AS Integer) RETURNS Integer  
        LET rowCount BE LENGTH OF mat  
        LET colCount BE LENGTH OF FIRST ELEMENT IN mat  
        LET baseSum BE 0  
        LET accumulator BE 0  
        WHILE accumulator < rowCount  
            baseSum ← baseSum + mat[accumulator][0]  
            accumulator ← accumulator + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        LET startIndices BE A TUPLE WITH rowCount COPIES OF 0  
        LET heapList BE A LIST CONTAINING (baseSum, startIndices)  
        LET seenIndices BE A SET CONTAINING startIndices  
        
        LOOP UNTIL k IS 0  
            EXTRACT (currentSum, currentIndices) FROM heapList BY REMOVING SMALLEST ELEMENT  
            k ← k - 1  
            
            IF k = 0 THEN RETURN currentSum END IF  
            
            LET position BE 0  
            WHILE position < rowCount DO  
                LET currentIndexValue BE currentIndices[position]  
                IF currentIndexValue + 1 < colCount THEN  
                    LET tempIndices BE CONVERT_TO_LIST(currentIndices)  
                    LET tempIndexValue BE tempIndices[position] + 1  
                    tempIndices[position] ← tempIndexValue  
                    LET nextIndices BE CONVERT_TO_TUPLE(tempIndices)  
                    
                    LET replacedSumPart BE mat[position][currentIndexValue]  
                    LET newSumPart BE mat[position][tempIndexValue]  
                    LET updatedSum BE currentSum - replacedSumPart + newSumPart  
                    
                    IF nextIndices NOT IN seenIndices THEN  
                        ADD nextIndices TO seenIndices  
                        ADD (updatedSum, nextIndices) TO heapList  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                position ← position + 1  
            END WHILE  
        END LOOP  
        
        RETURN -1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION maxDotProduct(nums1 PARAMETER, nums2 PARAMETER)  
        SET length1 AS LENGTH OF nums1  
        SET length2 AS LENGTH OF nums2  
        CREATE dp AS LIST OF LISTS  
        FOR index1 FROM 0 TO length1  
            CREATE row AS LIST  
            FOR index2 FROM 0 TO length2  
                APPEND NEGATIVE_INFINITY TO row  
            END FOR  
            APPEND row TO dp  
        END FOR  

        SET outerCounter TO 1  
        WHILE outerCounter <= length1  
            SET innerCounter TO 1  
            WHILE innerCounter <= length2  
                SET productCurrent TO (nums1[outerCounter - 1]) * (nums2[innerCounter - 1])  
                SET choice1 TO productCurrent  
                SET choice2 TO dp[outerCounter - 1][innerCounter]  
                SET choice3 TO dp[outerCounter][innerCounter - 1]  
                SET choice4 TO dp[outerCounter - 1][innerCounter - 1] + productCurrent  
                
                SET dp[outerCounter][innerCounter] TO choice1  
                IF choice2 > dp[outerCounter][innerCounter]  
                    SET dp[outerCounter][innerCounter] TO choice2  
                END IF  
                IF choice3 > dp[outerCounter][innerCounter]  
                    SET dp[outerCounter][innerCounter] TO choice3  
                END IF  
                IF choice4 > dp[outerCounter][innerCounter]  
                    SET dp[outerCounter][innerCounter] TO choice4  
                END IF  
                
                INCREMENT innerCounter BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT outerCounter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN dp[length1][length2]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

            SET currSum TO currSum + currCount  
            
            WHILE windowStart <= rightPtr  
                SET leftPos TO fruits[windowStart][0]  
                SET rightPos TO fruits[rightPtr][0]  
                SET leftCondInclusive TO (startPos - k)  
                SET rightCondInclusive TO (startPos + k)  
                SET distLeft TO ABS(leftPos - startPos)  
                SET distRight TO ABS(rightPos - startPos)  
                SET minDist TO IF distLeft < distRight THEN distLeft ELSE distRight  
                SET rangeSpan TO rightPos - leftPos  
                SET condition1 TO (leftCondInclusive <= leftPos) AND (leftPos <= rightCondInclusive)  
                SET condition2 TO (leftCondInclusive <= rightPos) AND (rightPos <= rightCondInclusive)  
                SET condition3 TO ((minDist + rangeSpan) <= k)  
                IF NOT (condition1 AND condition2 AND condition3) THEN  
                    SET currSum TO currSum - fruits[windowStart][1]  
                    SET windowStart TO windowStart + 1  
                ELSE  
                    BREAK  
                END IF  
            END WHILE  
            
            IF resultMax < currSum  
                SET resultMax TO currSum  
            END IF  
            SET rightPtr TO rightPtr + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN resultMax  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION shoppingOffers(price, special, needs)
        SET filtered_special TO empty collection
        SET idx TO 0
        WHILE idx < LENGTH(special)
            SET bundle TO special[idx]
            SET sum_items TO 0
            SET total_value TO 0
            SET pos TO 0
            WHILE pos < LENGTH(bundle) - 1
                SET sum_items TO sum_items + bundle[pos]
                SET total_value TO total_value + bundle[pos] * price[pos]
                INCREMENT pos BY 1
            END WHILE
            IF sum_items > 0 AND bundle[LENGTH(bundle) - 1] < total_value THEN
                APPEND bundle TO filtered_special
            END IF
            INCREMENT idx BY 1
        END WHILE
        
        FUNCTION dfs(current_needs)
            SET minimal_cost TO 0
            DECLARE counter AS 0
            WHILE counter < LENGTH(price)
                SET minimal_cost TO minimal_cost + price[counter] * current_needs[counter]
                INCREMENT counter BY 1
            END WHILE
            
            SET offer_index TO 0
            WHILE offer_index < LENGTH(filtered_special)
                SET offer_bundle TO filtered_special[offer_index]
                SET updated_needs TO empty collection
                FOR position IN 0 TO LENGTH(current_needs) - 1
                    APPEND current_needs[position] - offer_bundle[position] TO updated_needs
                END FOR
                
                SET eligible TO TRUE
                FOR demand IN updated_needs
                    IF demand < 0 THEN
                        SET eligible TO FALSE
                        EXIT FOR
                    END IF
                END FOR
                
                IF eligible THEN
                    SET cost_if_used TO offer_bundle[LENGTH(offer_bundle) - 1] + dfs(CONVERT_TO_TUPLE(updated_needs))
                    IF cost_if_used < minimal_cost THEN
                        SET minimal_cost TO cost_if_used
                    END IF
                END IF
                
                INCREMENT offer_index BY 1
            END WHILE
            
            RETURN minimal_cost
        END FUNCTION
        
        RETURN dfs(CONVERT_TO_TUPLE(needs))
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

                APPEND offer TO special

                INCREMENT min_cost BY the element at position index of price MULTIPLIED BY the element at position index of needs

                        SET can_use_offer TO false

                    END IF  
                END FOR  
                
                IF can_use_offer EQUALS true

                        SET min_cost TO possible_cost  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            
            RETURN min_cost  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        RETURN dfs(the tuple version of needs)  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION areSentencesSimilarTwo(sentence1 sentence1 TO sentence1 OF TYPE list OF strings sentence2 sentence2 TO sentence2 OF TYPE list OF strings similarPairs similarPairs TO similarPairs OF TYPE list OF list OF strings) RETURNS boolean
        IF LENGTH sentence1 == LENGTH sentence2 THEN
        ELSE
            RETURN false
        END IF

        DECLARE registry AS dictionary = {}

        FUNCTION find(element element TO element) RETURNS element
            DECLARE stack AS list = []
            DECLARE current AS element = element
            WHILE current != registry[current] DO
                PUSH current INTO stack
                SET current = registry[current]
            END WHILE
            FOR each node IN stack DO
                SET registry[node] = current
            END FOR
            RETURN current
        END FUNCTION

        FUNCTION union(first first TO first second second TO second)
            DECLARE rootFirst AS first = find(first)
            DECLARE rootSecond AS second = find(second)
            IF rootFirst != rootSecond THEN
                SET registry[rootSecond] = rootFirst
            END IF
        END FUNCTION

        DECLARE index1 AS int = 0
        WHILE index1 < LENGTH similarPairs DO
            DECLARE couple AS list = similarPairs[index1]
            DECLARE idxWord AS int = 0
            WHILE idxWord < LENGTH couple DO
                DECLARE token AS string = couple[idxWord]
                IF NOT token IN registry THEN
                    SET registry[token] = token
                END IF
                SET idxWord = idxWord + 1
            END WHILE
            SET index1 = index1 + 1
        END WHILE

        DECLARE idxPair AS int = 0
        WHILE idxPair < LENGTH similarPairs DO
            DECLARE a AS string = similarPairs[idxPair][0]
            DECLARE b AS string = similarPairs[idxPair][1]
            CALL union(a b)
            SET idxPair = idxPair + 1
        END WHILE

        DECLARE pos AS int = 0
        WHILE pos < LENGTH sentence1 DO
            DECLARE firstWord AS string = sentence1[pos]
            DECLARE secondWord AS string = sentence2[pos]
            IF NOT firstWord IN registry THEN
                SET registry[firstWord] = firstWord
            END IF
            IF NOT secondWord IN registry THEN
                SET registry[secondWord] = secondWord
            END IF

            IF find(firstWord) != find(secondWord) THEN
                RETURN false
            END IF
            SET pos = pos + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN true
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION areSentencesSimilarTwo(sentence1 sentence1 TO sentence1 OF TYPE list OF strings sentence2 sentence2 TO sentence2 OF TYPE list OF strings similarPairs similarPairs TO similarPairs OF TYPE list OF list OF strings) RETURNS boolean  
        IF the LENGTH OF sentence1 NOT EQUALS the LENGTH OF sentence2  
            RETURN false  
        END IF  

        SET parent TO empty dictionary  

        FUNCTION find(x x TO x) RETURNS x  
            IF element at position x of parent NOT EQUALS x  
                SET element at position x of parent TO find(element at position x of parent)  
            END IF  
            RETURN element at position x of parent  
        END FUNCTION  

        FUNCTION union(x x TO x y y TO y)  
            SET rootX TO find(x)  
            SET rootY TO find(y)  
            IF rootX NOT EQUALS rootY  
                SET element at position rootY of parent TO rootX  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION  

        FOR each pair IN similarPairs  
            FOR each word IN pair  
                IF word NOT IN parent  
                    SET element at position word of parent TO word  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        FOR each x y IN similarPairs  
            union(x y)  
        END FOR  

        FOR each w1 w2 IN sentence1 sentence2  
            IF w1 NOT IN parent  
                SET element at position w1 of parent TO w1  
            END IF  
            IF w2 NOT IN parent  
                SET element at position w2 of parent TO w2  
            END IF  
            IF find(w1) NOT EQUALS find(w2)  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        RETURN true  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION numFriendRequests(ages)
        FUNCTION request_will_be_sent(age_x age_y)
            IF age_y <= (age_x / 2 + 7) THEN
                RETURN false
            ELSE IF age_y > age_x THEN
                RETURN false
            ELSE IF (age_y > 100) AND (age_x < 100) THEN
                RETURN false
            ELSE
                RETURN true
            END IF
        END FUNCTION

        SET tally TO dictionary()
        SET idx TO 0
        WHILE idx < LENGTH(ages)
            IF ages[idx] IN tally THEN
                tally[ages[idx]] = tally[ages[idx]] + 1
            ELSE
                tally[ages[idx]] = 1
            END IF
            idx = idx + 1
        END WHILE

        SET accumulated TO 0
        SET p_age_x TO 1
        WHILE p_age_x <= 120
            SET p_age_y TO 1
            WHILE p_age_y <= 120
                IF request_will_be_sent(p_age_x, p_age_y) THEN
                    IF p_age_x = p_age_y THEN
                        accumulated = accumulated + (tally.get(p_age_x, 0) * (tally.get(p_age_y, 0) - 1))
                    ELSE
                        accumulated = accumulated + (tally.get(p_age_x, 0) * tally.get(p_age_y, 0))
                    END IF
                END IF
                p_age_y = p_age_y + 1
            END WHILE
            p_age_x = p_age_x + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN accumulated
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION numFriendRequests(ages)  
        FUNCTION request_will_be_sent(age_x age_y)  
            RETURN NOT (age_y IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO age_x MULTIPLIED BY one half PLUS seven OR age_y IS GREATER THAN age_x OR age_y IS GREATER THAN one hundred AND age_x IS LESS THAN one hundred)  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET count TO list of zero repeated one hundred and twenty one times  
        FOR each age IN ages  
            INCREMENT element at position age of count BY one  
        END FOR  

        SET total_requests TO zero  
        FOR age_x FROM one TO one hundred and twenty  
            FOR age_y FROM one TO one hundred and twenty  
                IF request_will_be_sent(age_x age_y)  
                    INCREMENT total_requests BY element at position age_x of count MULTIPLIED BY element at position age_y of count MINUS one IF age_x EQUALS age_y ELSE element at position age_y of count  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        RETURN total_requests  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
